summary: Koine Greek was a widely spoken language during ancient times, especially in the Mediterranean and Middle East. It developed after Alexander the Great's conquests and combined different Greek dialects, mainly Attic and Ionic. This language was used for both everyday communication and important literary works. The New Testament and many early Christian writings were also in Koine Greek. Over time, it evolved into Medieval and then Modern Greek. Today, it is still used in some Greek church services.
title: Koine Greek
